summary.body: Are  there any experienced Mah Jong players who would like to have a game? Although I have a Mah Jong set I haven't played for a few years - and I would need help and guidance to have even a rudimentary game. We would need at least four participating players to start up a school.
summary.subject: Mah Jong players?

summary.body: I thought it might be amusing to complile a list of where people have spotted the Barbican sink.  I'm afraid McDonalds and Carluccios and anywhere in the Barbican don't count. I do have a trump card but like all good gamblers I will hold that up my sleeve.  My starter for 10: Love India:  Indian Restaurant on Fulham Road
summary.subject: Spot the Barbican Sink Competition

summary.body: How many Roads are there in the CITY?
summary.subject: QUIZ

summary.body: Hello, Google Maps recently updated their images and have closer detail pictures for most of London. I noticed when looking at the Barbican that it looks as if they took the pictures during the summer fair in the garden! Perhaps you can see yourself via satellite, the link is here   (click 'satellite' at the top right and use the slider on the left to zoom right in and you should see the gardens with clearly visible Barbican residents walking about, tents etc. Extra brownie points if you can identify yourself or a group of friends sitting around somewhere - considered really very good piece of geekery to be able to identify yourself on Google Earth / Google Maps.)
summary.subject: Spies in the sky - summer party
